subject: Self Care
title: REM Sleep and Memory
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: REM Sleep and Memory.

hook.text: Students who slept after studying scored 40% higher than those who crammed through the night instead.

buildup.text: REM sleep replays the day's experiences. Your brain sorts, connects, and files memories for keeps.

discovery.text: During REM, the brain links new information to old knowledge, creating insights you missed awake.

twist.text: REM is concentrated in the last cycles of sleep. Cutting sleep short destroys the memory phase.

climax.text: Sleeping a full night after learning is not laziness. It is the final step of the learning process.

punchline.text: REM sleep is where memories become permanent.

quiz.question: When during the night does most REM sleep occur?
options: In the last cycles of the night
